nodes.bodyText: this seems like a significant change, does this setup require the deployment of wcp-resources as a separate pod?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,46 +1,25 @@
-# User registration server root URL
-fda.registration.root.url=http://dummy-value/myStudiesUserMgmtWS
-
-#For server
-fda.imgUploadPath=/webapps/fdaResources/
-fda.currentPath=catalina.home
-fda.imgDisplaydPath=/fdaResources/
-
-#For  server
-acceptLinkMail =http://${BASE_URL}/studybuilder/createPassword.do?securityToken=
-login.url=http://${BASE_URL}/studybuilder/login.do
-signUp.url=http://${BASE_URL}/studybuilder/signUp.do?securityToken=
-
-# TODO: Change the IP/port to an env var and pass it in yaml file instead.
-db.url=localhost:3306/${DB_NAME}
-db.username=${DB_USER}
-db.password=${DB_PASS}
 
 ########################## Web Configuration Portal Web-Services (WCP WS) Configuration Details  STARTS ##########################
 #DataBase Configuration
 # TODO: Change the IP/port to an env var and pass it in yaml file instead.
 # TODO: Figure out how to make hibernate respect env variables.
 # FOR NOW WE NEED TO MANUALLY CHANGE ${DB_NAME}, ${DB_USER} AND ${DB_PASS} IN THIS FILE BEFORE BUILDING THE IMAGE.
-hibernate.connection.url=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/${DB_NAME}?autoReconnect=true
+hibernate.connection.url=jdbc:mysql://${CLOUD_SQL_INSTANCE_IP}/${DB_NAME}?autoReconnect=true
 hibernate.connection.driver_class=com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver
 hibernate.connection.username=${DB_USER}
 hibernate.connection.password=${DB_PASS}
 
 fda.smd.catalinaPath=catalina.home
 
 #Study Image/Logo Path Local
-fda.smd.study.thumbnailPath=http://${BASE_URL}/fdaResources/studylogo/
-fda.smd.study.pagePath=http://${BASE_URL}/fdaResources/studypages/
-fda.smd.resource.pdfPath=http://${BASE_URL}/fdaResources/studyResources/
-fda.smd.questionnaire.image=http://${BASE_URL}/fdaResources/questionnaire/
-fda.smd.gatewayResource.pdfPath=http://${BASE_URL}/fdaResources/gatewayResource/App_Glossary.pdf
+fda.smd.study.thumbnailPath=${STUDY_BULDER_RESOURCE_URL}/studylogo/
+fda.smd.study.pagePath=${STUDY_BULDER_RESOURCE_URL}/studypages/
+fda.smd.resource.pdfPath=${STUDY_BULDER_RESOURCE_URL}/studyResources/

+fda.smd.gatewayResource.pdfPath=${STUDY_BULDER_RESOURCE_URL}/gatewayResource/App_Glossary.pdf

nodes.bodyText: My Bad.. separate pod will not work . As per existing deployment we need to use same gcpfuse only or resources needs to deploy under server where studybuilder deployed . Hence revert the changes and pointing to studybuilder now.

nodes.bodyText: I would like only the base URL to be passed in the properties file, other endpoints would ideally get generated in a java class that holds user_mgmt_service api information.
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText:
Please find Dhanya's comment in PR #890
We've followed same pattern in all the services for API endpoints, this requires lot of code changes if we need to build the endpoint from application. We'll keep the API endpoints in properties for this release and address this in next release if we really need to make the changes. I personally prefer to keep API endpoints in properties file.
